channel.title: What the fuck, Steam?
channel.description:
So I tried to start up Steam just now, it gave me the update bar, then all of a sudden it goes away and says it deleted the .exe but the "files are still there".
Huh?
Why the fuck did it do that?

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: Lost_one
item.description:
Meh, Sometimes I wish I didn’t have steam. While it is a good way to organize my games some times it’s just a hassle to use. I do miss the original screen of Half Life, well used to. I found old WON versions and installed those, but still. People who can’t be connected to the internet 24/7 like alot of us are at a disadvantage when it comes to steam. It means they can’t play their single player games 24/7 with out being online and they have to go find something else.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
But if I deactivate the updates, I would be missing the entire point of Steam! I mean I think Steam is good, and it’s better than standalone games in many ways. Overall, I like Steam a lot, however, there are some small things that sometimes bother me that didn’t happen before Steam. But this is just evolution, you have to lose some things to gain other things!

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Yeah, steam is a real b**** sometimes, but ya gotta love it.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
sersoft:

you can install steam games from a CD,
[COLOR=‘Red’]Whoop de doo
you can extract steam games and play them without steam,
[COLOR=‘Red’]Illegally, though. And no achievements.
you can run steam without access to the internet, steam can access the internet even if your ISP has suspended your connection due to non-payment…
[COLOR=‘Red’]Only you…
what more can you ask for?
[COLOR=‘Red’]FOSS

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
It’s an anti-Steam virus, sent from the guys at the WON2 site.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Steam shouldn’t have deleted the steam.exe file if it was in use. If it did, reinstall. If at least steam.exe is there, delete everything but that and the steamapps folder and run steam.exe and let it update

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
You should spank Steam, it has been bad.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
SURPLUS_NiNjA:

Doesn’t he actually have to be able to get onto steam to do that first?

but he is complaining as in a general situation, not in this particular occasion. either way, he could’ve set the no updates options before this time.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
you can install steam games from a CD, you can extract steam games and play them without steam, you can run steam without access to the internet, steam can access the internet even if your ISP has suspended your connection due to non-payment… what more can you ask for?

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
acade366:

you know that you can deactivate automatic updates, dont you?

Doesn’t he actually have to be able to get onto steam to do that first?

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
higgsboson:

getting updated with something that you didn’t even agree to?

I like the idea of Steam but I hate that each time I want to play a game, I have to wait until it downloads updates to Steam. And that it complains if I don’t have an internet connection: I don’t need an internet connection to play Half-Life 2, so wtf?

you know that you can deactivate automatic updates, dont you?

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
I do and dont, its great, I can be lazy as hell, let steam do all the work.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
No, I don’t.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
Don’t you miss the good old days of having actual games with an actual icon that linked to an actual .exe and you would not have to worry about it stopping to work randomly and getting updated with something that you didn’t even agree to?

I like the idea of Steam but I hate that each time I want to play a game, I have to wait until it downloads updates to Steam. And that it complains if I don’t have an internet connection: I don’t need an internet connection to play Half-Life 2, so wtf?

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Steam does fuck around sometimes. After an update it stopped working for me and I couldn’t be bothered to mess with it so I just played my non-stem games. Then a couple of days later another update and voila, it’s working again. Go figure.
I do think you might have to reinstall it though…

Read full topic

item.title: What the fuck, Steam?
item.dc:creator: bobbo
item.description:
Does steam sill run after that happens. Do you get the error still? The “files are still there”?
If the .exe is sill there run the steam.exe out of the main folder.

Read full topic

because.
